para.sentence: Generalized spheroidal wave functions and Coulomb spheroidal functions are solutions of the differential equation \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}z}\left((1-z^{2})\frac{\mathrm{d}w}{\mathrm{d}z} \right)+{\left(\lambda+\alpha z+\gamma^{2}(1-z^{2})-\frac{\mu^{2}}{1-z^{2}} \right)w}=0, which reduces to (30.2.1) if \alpha=0.
Equation (30.12.1) appears in astrophysics and molecular physics.
For the theory and computation of solutions of (30.12.1) seeFalloon (2001), Judd (1975), Leaver (1986), and Komarov et al. (1976).

Another generalization is provided by the differential equation \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}z}\left((1-z^{2})\frac{\mathrm{d}w}{\mathrm{d}z} \right)+\left(\lambda+\gamma^{2}(1-z^{2})-\frac{\alpha(\alpha+1)}{z^{2}}-\frac {\mu^{2}}{1-z^{2}}\right)w=0, which also reduces to (30.2.1) when \alpha=0.
SeeLeitner and Meixner (1960), Slepian (1964) with \mu=0 , andMeixner et al. (1980).
